paper_abstract: We introduce a new tractable temporal constraint language, which strictly contains the Ord-Horn language of Burkert and Nebel and the class of AND/OR precedence constraints. The algorithm we present for this language decides whether a given set of constraints is consistent in time that is quadratic in the input size. We also prove that (unlike Ord-Horn) the constraint satisfaction problem of this language cannot be solved by Datalog or by establishing local consistency.
paper_title: A Fast Algorithm and Datalog Inexpressibility for Temporal Reasoning
